evolution_stages.conversation_summary: 1) PROBLEMS: Zachary discussed burnout from juggling research/student government/organic chem, difficulty delegating specialized science policy work, and public speaking anxiety. 2) SOLUTIONS: Coach suggested blocking research hours on lighter days (Tues/Thurs), delegating via structured training (Zoom recordings + shadowing), and practicing speeches using 'one structured point' with audio feedback. 3) RESPONSE: Zachary enthusiastically implemented solutions by creating a lab safety training system with interactive Q&A, developing an 'Escape the Lab' game, and expanding into a 'Global Lab Safety' video project. He also created innovative stress-management systems ('Wasabi Wellness Infographic') and networking strategies ('dumpling diplomacy'). 4) PROGRESS: Demonstrated significant initiative by prototyping training games, storyboarding videos, developing cross-cultural networking protocols, and creating campus-wide stress management tools - showing reduced anxiety through creative engagement and solution ownership.

1) Problems discussed: Burnout from balancing pre-med/research/student gov, difficulty delegating science policy tasks, and public speaking anxiety. 2) Solutions offered/accepted: Time-blocking research hours, 3-step delegation process (starter tasks/shared docs/paired work), and structured public speaking practice with recording/feedback. 3) Student's response: Enthusiastically developed solutions into concrete systems - created lab safety training with interactive quizzes/gamification, storyboarded a safety trailer, and innovated culinary-based networking/study methods ('wok-and-talk' sessions, 'kimchi collaboration'). 4) Evidence of progress: Transformed delegation challenge into leadership opportunity (department adopting his methods), channeled anxiety into creative projects (safety game livestream plan), and developed unique stress-management approaches (culinary study breaks) that attracted departmental recognition and career services tracking.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: 1) Problems discussed: Burnout from over-scheduling, public speaking anxiety in meetings/lecture halls, difficulty delegating science policy work, and implied roommate tensions. 2) Solutions offered/accepted: Structured public speaking practice (5-min talks + self-recording), delegation system (training docs → shadowing → Q&A polls), and creative reframing of challenges into the 'lab safety game' project. 3) Student's response: Enthusiastically expanded solutions (e.g., adding cultural elements, gamification, filming), created concrete plans (Zoom training Thursday, game beta-test), and developed novel systems ('Wasabi Wellness Infographic', 'ramen timer'). 4) Evidence of progress: Transformed lecture hall anxiety into filming opportunity, developed measurable delegation metrics (Q&A polls), initiated mentor connections through project, and created stress-management tools ('kimchi confidence protocol') showing proactive solution-building.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: 1) Problems discussed: Burnout from balancing pre-med workload/student government, delegation difficulties, public speaking anxiety, and mentor search. 2) Solutions offered/accepted: Structured delegation system with training materials, using meetings for public speaking practice, converting projects into networking opportunities, and cultural food exchanges for organic mentorship. 3) Student's response: Enthusiastically developed 'Lab Safety Escape Room' game to delegate tasks, created film projects to practice public speaking, and initiated food diplomacy for networking. 4) Evidence of progress: Transformed anxiety triggers into leadership opportunities (department adopting his safety game), decreased public speaking fear (filming lectures), developed stress-coping systems ('Kimchi Confidence Protocol'), and established mentor connections through cultural exchanges.
